reviewText:
TLDR; While this game is undeniably old, thus the dated graphics, but I still think it's a pretty cool game to dive in.

Note: This review was done during my experience with the early game life within Lucent Heart, and is subjected to change in the near future when I reaches the later game contents.

I've played quite a bit back when the game was handled by a different company. I took a long hiatus from the game then and now I'm onto a fresh start all over again from level 1. It's been quite a while since I last played this, so I've forgotten lots of basic knowledge of the game, therefore I'm no different than any other regular newbies.

When you first login into the world, you'll be welcomed by the rather dated graphics. Since this game was released more than 5+ years ago, this is quite understandable. The day and night cycles are implimented and some monsters were supposedly appear during a certain time (which is a pretty neat feature imo).

The community so far as I've experienced was very friendly and welcoming. Although there were very much afkers hanging around in town, when you asked for help, a lot of people were eager to offer their knowledge of the game which put a smile on my face.

I enjoy playing solo most of the time in MMOs, while sometimes I do find myself participating a few dungeon runs here and there, if the game is possible to tackle alone, I much prefer it that way. That's being said, this game is certainly solo-friendly in the early game, and is very encouraging towards team work later on in game.

This game follows the same MMO formula as the others, the questing system is quite generic with the go here
recommended: come back and return the quest to this npc" type and would probably be tiresome as this goes on
hoursPlayed: but since I'm a casual player
voteText: this doesn't concern me that much. Especially understanding that most MMOs were designed to be played that way anyways
helpfulPercent: and this game certainly tries its best to redeem itself with some fun events with mini DDR-like game (It was called Dance Masters
votesHelpful: I think. Correct me if I'm wrong.) and possibly upcoming trivia-type event for players to get involved in.\n\nSo
votesTotal: overall (as of now) I'm voting "yes" for recommending this game :)"

reviewText:
Lucent Heart, what can I say.

First off, I'm one of the dedicated players who've been playing this for years and I am happy to see it on Steam. However, it didn't went on here without its struggles. Yes, it doesn't have the best graphics, best storyline or the best anything, but this is pretty old. And if you're like me, chances are, you love this game as much as the other player that you invested over thousands of hours into it. Which I did. I would say Lucent Heart is one of those games you played in your childhood and you simply fell in love with it, like Zelda or FF7, Lucent Heart gives off the same vibe and that's one of the charms of this game.

Lucent Heart is a classic anime MMORPG developed by a Taiwanese company called 'Playcoo' and it is staggeringly popular in Japan and other Asian countries, while it is not as popular in the West, it is alive and well through these years thanks to a hardcore fanbase and Subagames who've been running it. Lucent Heart not only offers such a unique storyline and visual design but is bundled with features. Unfortunately, not all of them are out yet because Lucent Heart is currently version 10.0, but regardless, it still have plenty to offer for the time being.

Features

Lover System
Many people have found their true love through this game, though i like to think it's not a dating game, the theme of this game suggest so. (Note: This game is not dedicated to romance stuff.) But people have met and even marry in RL. Good for them, but what about you, the reader? Well if you are interested, Lucent Heart have a system called Soulmate where you can sign up with Cupid NPC and find your, well, soulmate. And if you feel she/he's the right one for you, then you can marry in-game. And yes, you can marry same-sex user, hurray for equality! (In later version, you may able to create and raise a child regardless of your gender.)

GvG/PvP
I'm sure you know what these stand for. You can't have MMORPG without a little rivalry. And boy oh boy, you better be careful playing in these matches, it's pretty brutal. In GvG, guilds are challenged randomly by opponent guild according to the system and the Guilds' strength. And you play to win by most points from killing enemies or destroying their flags. Depending how the battle plays out, GvG has 3 rounds and occurs on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Very exciting. However, if you're in a mood for PvP, there is a channel 'Underworld - PvP' where you can freely kill players outside of the towns. Scary.

Housing
While I wouldn't say it's the best feature, you are given an house at lv25 and able to decorate your own place. And if you're brave enough, you can invade people's homes in acquire special items and points, as well as rating their home decoration.

Transportation
Transports is a must because Lucent Heart is big, pretty big. If you don't like walking all the way to your destination then you can always hop onto the Airship, there are five airships available to different stops and require no fees. Pretty sweet. But if you prefer riding mounts, keep on reading.

Mounts and Pets
Lucent got unicorns, carriage, lions, motorbikes, rhinos and even robots for mounts. It's quite a spectacle in the town, you'd be surprise how well they fit in. You also get support from your pets, or um.. *cough* slave http://puu.sh/n6H8U/f588594fe3.jpg http://puu.sh/n6HfN/208223361d.jpg Cute, aren't they? Ehehe..hehe Of course, this game also offers pets" handsome guys.

Character customisation
From the start

You can play Solo

reviewText:
Cons:
Dated graphics.
Combat has some minor interesting features, but remains a standard point-and-click system.
Some fashion clothing pieces in the item mall give a direct stat increase bonus.
Extremely grindy.

Pros:
In-Depth romance system: Soulmate Finder, Marriage, Lover Emotes (Hugging, kissing, etc.)
Active community: Main city appears quite active. Someone is always willing to help in chat. Lots of people running around, although that might be because this just released on Steam.
Horoscope system: You gain stat boosts depending on your horoscope. From critical hit chance, to treasure finding, to love chance(?)
Customization: Large amount of fashion options for your character. From entire costume sets, to minions, to a wide variety of mounts.

Opinion:
I can say that I won't be playing this myself. I am not at all interested in a romance system and the community doesn't feel particularly exciting or different. However, if you're looking for an anime mmo with romancing features that isn't dead and doesn't require a good PC/Laptop to run properly. Chances are you might like this.
voteText: 54 of 75 people (72%) found this review helpful 7 people found this review funny

reviewText:
A lot of people have been bad-mouthing this game when in actual fact, I'm in love with it.

I started a couple days ago and I've already got 7 people who are happy to see me the next time I log on and eager to help me in my quests.
People are saying it's such a grind to level up when I'm already level 17 because I made high level friends.
The community is awesome. Admittidly there are some trolls but you can just blacklist and ignore them. I was happy to be welcomed into the community with open arms and all because I sat near a group of people around a guy on a bench XD

The quests are boring if you have to do them alone but if you take breaks by dancing and chatting with people you make friends who are happy to help you level up.
The Cupid system is slow but you can purchase Cupid Keys with real money if you can't be bothered waiting for Cupid.

I've only come across two creepy people who I ignored and they left me alone.

If you are new to the game then I recommend going on the Athens server and talking to Firewolf because he is happy to help any newbies and doesn't nearly get enough praise for it. He's over level 70 and you can often find him sitting on a bench talking about FDVR XD

I am seriously enjoying this game and I am 100% proud to be part of the community.

reviewText:
First of all, I just wanna put this out there before I start my review. I personally like the game, as you can tell from hours of playing, but Ill not be bias and will be professional about the review, rating.
my review will consist of Pros, Neutral and Cons( things with * next to it will be unique features in this game)
(Before I start doing pros I just wanna say IT'S ACTUALLY REALLY HARDCORE, the monsters will kill you if youre not prepare, the dungeon you can't solo at minimum level requirement.... I tried and didn't even make it through the first 3 monsters. a server with open world pvp that is connected to your character at pve server, which means one character can  join both pve and pvp server.)
Ok lets start with the pros
Pros:
***DANCE DANCE REVOLUTION AND CAR RACING (Yes you can play DDR and pk other players and play mario kart)
Bright anime style graphics with the medieval-ish theme and yet with modern buildings and structures.
*Zodiac systems with your own zodiac power and zodiac armor.(which is pretty cool actually, if you get to level 30)
Cupid Matching system, which will match you with players that you have common interests in or in the same level range.
GMs are really active in the game( I mean like really active, you can strike a conversion with GM in zone chat and GM will talk if not busy. GM also will join the conversion you're having in zone chat) which not alot of GM in games do that.
*Zodiac pets and mythology battle pets. (Such as taurrus pet, death, hercules, apollo, joan of arc..etc)
Thousands of quests.
New class call phantom warlock(Shape shifter)
Neutral :
Tab targeting (I put this as neutral because theres no reason to bash on  a play style hard and give it a bad review because it's old style or isn't your style of play)
Cons:
The monsters are just duplicate of other monster under different name.
Skill effects looks plain and boring.
Music isn't really good and it makes you wanna turn it off.
Lack of good story (I'm BIG HUGE lore reader, league of legend has good lore, WoW, Mabinogi...etc)
Isn't really fun without friends or someone to chat with.
Quests gets boring.
Monster fields are plain with one or two trees here and there.
The user interface doesn't look appealing.

With this, I hope I can help someone decide if they wanna play this game or not
I know it's alot of stuff to read q w q thanks for reading it
Over all Ill give this game a 5/10

reviewText:
Ignore the play hours, I played this before it came to Steam. When I was looking for it, I wanted something cute and relaxing, yet fun to play. I'll state some pros and cons.
----------
PROS
----------
- cute animations
- marriage system
- friendly player base
- housing system
- content for 2 players
- cute chars and clothing
----------
CONS
----------
- unstable servers (lags)
- very slow combat
- 95% of quests are fetch-type quests, just go there kill that
- story line is there, but not at al interesting, doesn't pull you in
- doesn't keep you interested if you play alone
- class imbalance
- dated graphics, many bugs
- game doesn't change at all, when you ignore the cash shop updates
- buggy skills (played priest)

Basically this game was fun just because I had someone to play it with. The social aspect is amazing and I have nothing to complain about, but the combat just felt horrible. Most of the time I just found myself autorunning or killing monsters, it seemed to me as if there wasn't even other type of quest. Graphics are dated, although I never really judge a game by it and having that said, I think they're easy to get used to. The leveling is ultra-slow and entire process is just hardcore grind-fest. I don't have anything against that, but it just feels like game has not that much to offer in this department. I can't tell much about crafting/pvp, as I hasn't been introduced to it yet at all by quests. It's fun if you play it with your SO for a few hours, but after all it's worth investing your time into other game.

reviewText:
(Pay no attention to the game-playing time. I've played this game pre-Steam)

PROS:
- You can look cute since apparently all the GM's ever do is update the item mall
- You can only look cute when you buy the clothes though.
- Okay I take it back. No pros :<

CONS:
- Sure it's free-to-play, but it's kind of pay-to-win. You're basically unable to do anything significant (in higher levels) unless you're decked out with your pet squad (consisting of four passive bonds that you can get from gachapons in the item mall) with your matching item mall mount.
- You can buy said items above from players with in-game gold. However, I doubt new players can rack up hundreds of millions worth of gold to be able to afford those expensive items.
- Bad management in Suba's part; I sent in a ticket several months ago but still no response up to this day. Hey, if you can't do anything about the situation, at least let me know. Don't leave me hangin'
- When looking for a soulmate (someone to level with and earn charm points with IN-GAME) equates to attempting to find a signifcant other in-real-life (red flag alert -  I'm only here to play the game, not hook up with you, bud. This is not netflix and chill)

reviewText:
Pros:

- Somewhat interesting character designs
- Unique game features such as pairing
- Online play seems fine, no lag etc
- You can level up quickly if you know how to
- There is usually at least one server with lots of players in
- Missions are usually easy to follow

Cons:

- Limited character choice
- User interface needs tweeking if not completely re-designing
- The game can close without warning in some situations
- Some of the most ridiculous in game accessories I'll probably ever see
- Boring repetitive missions
- Almost non-existent story line (edit: apparently it is there so I'm told)
- Music gets annoying (I ended up muting it)
- Sound effects are limited
- What's even the point in playing? Where does it go?

Sorry, I'm not feeling it.

reviewText:
Made me feel nostalgic as balls. Used to play this back at 10th grade, and whenever I hear the soundtrack of Thereall/the login screen, loading screen, and character selection screen, I always feel this strong nostalgia... Like I'm back at 10th grade, about to leave for my ♥♥♥♥ing first final of the year.

It was fun, but the game's running on a ♥♥♥♥ing Pay2Win model, and everyone knows it. If I ever do play, it's only when I'm chilling in Thereall doing absolutely nothing.
The game is a pretty generic P2W MMORPG. You got a warrior, a mage, and a gunner. You fight monsters for some moronic reason, waste days of your lives on getting a special weapon at level 50, and get bored of it after that because leveling up from level 50 to 60 is as hard as me :^). After that, you just end up internet dating some catfish for the rest of the time you're on the game.
Anyway, if you're reading the reviews for this ♥♥♥♥ game, I don't suggest you download it. LH is much better. 6/9 - Best RPG on steam 2016 - VogavGaming (pls sobskryb tnx)

Memes aside though, if you do end up playing it and need a helping hand for like... 30 minutes (because that's all I can spend on this game before I get bored) then Whisper me. Name's Boidem on this game.

reviewText:
It took me about twenty minutes to actually get into the game--it wouldn't let me log in through the steam overlay no matter how hard I tried. Once in the game, I was greeted with god-awful lag.

TLDR; if you like laggy systems, repetitive music and god-awful sound, and empty areas, this is the game for you!

I can't say anything positive about this game, so here's just all the bull that I was greeted with:

1) Attributes are based on zodiac + blood type. ????? Well, a'ight, then. I guess, I mean??
2) Miserable lag. (My computer can run other MMOs just fine, I don't know what this one's problem was)
3) Empty area. Where was everyone? I called out into the abyss that I now call hell for a solid five minutes, walked around, it was empty. Just lonely NPCs begging for death. Well, they were probably begging for death. UPDATE: I logged back in, called out into the abyss again. A guy approached me. He was silent for a few minutes before he just disappeared (or I didn't see him run due to lag).
4) I can't tell if the collision detection was bad or if it was just the lag ???
5) Not many character creation options--hoo boy that was all grotesque. Same-face-same-body is what we're looking at here, folks.
6) Hoo boy that noise was miserable, too. Repetitive. It didn't help that I could barely walk anywhere--so really I was stuck with the same flute sound effect, the same birds chirping, and the same BG music looping. At one point, everything stopped, and I silently hoped that the game crashed. It did not. Birds started chirping again, that god-awful flute and BG loop started again, and that weird water (???) noise picked back up.

reviewText:
I didn't get to far in this game but what I did see I didn't like.
The beginner quests are kinda clunky, and then the battle system.... oh my gosh, it was bad.
I'd go up to an monster attack it, then either I'd stand there not beeing able to move or antything while the monster kept wacking at me, or I'd be running off in random directions complety missing the monster when I tried to hit it, and it still keeps on hitting me. But what really annoyed me is how it would keep swiching out of the game to another window so I only knew what was gooing on half the time.  trying to attack one thing was not easy and it wasn't the fun kind of diffculty either.  Like I know battles in Tera are really hard but also really fun and satisfying. Still I know I it's not fair to compare this game to that game, as you could eaisly say they are in differnt weight classes"  but still even compared to games like maplestory or Uncharted Watters which i think are at least closer to beeing in the same league they certianly pull of their games right from the getgo much better then what I saw of this one.  I'd say it's less of a time waster playing those games then this one.

Also the Area was complety empty no sign of other players at all
date: now I might of given them some credit for having a single player tutorial campagin but least give me some sign that there's other people on line
recommended: and it didn't seem like there was a story arc gooing on with the tutorial quests it was just a group of people who refered me to the next goup getting me slowly closer hopefully to a regular town.\n\nThe cash shop had a bunch of nice items in it
voteText: while i don't think they are super expensive compared to the cash shop in other games I've played I think they are on the higher side of the average.\n\nSo while this isn't the worst game I've played

reviewText:
Where do I start?
The sound is repetitive and horrible
The gameplay is on par with the very worst we could offer in 2005
The graphics are as above
The sounds, oh my god, the sounds
I have 27 minutes of playtime, and I got  stuck twice because the collision detection is so bad.
The art direction is pathetically trite. Nothing unique or clever about it, as near as I can tell. It's like a bad knock off of flyff. In fact, if you want to play a mediocre MMO from the far east, play Flyff instead, that way you'll only feel like you're living in 2006.
I can honestly say that normally a game can be so bad it's entertaining. With this, it's simply so bad that it's bad. It's genuinely complete garbage. I bought a $40 rice cooker that overheats when you cook rice with it and turns itself off. I am less disappointed in that than I am with this game, and I didn't even pay for it. It was literally not worth the time it took for me to download the 3.1 gigabytes that I can only assume was taken up by the intro cinematic, considering that all five assets in the game are used everywhere that I've seen. Genuinely, those 27 minutes are 27 minutes of my life that I will never get back, 27 minutes that I could have spent with a beloved family member, or maybe ate a nice lunch, took a bath or a long shower, built something, something, anything, other than waste it with this. I am 27 minutes older, and 27 minutes closer to death thanks to this game, and it's one of the few times in my life where I regret the time it took from my existence. May god have mercy on their souls.

4/10

reviewText:
Took about 5 minutes to see how dated and mediocre this point and click mmo is. I'm not just talking about graphics. Honestly I could care less about that aspect. It's just about everything else. This game is pretty much just another skin of most point and clickers you'd seen the past decade but with sub-par UI with very little in game options to tweak that'd ease the pain.
The gimmick to this game is focused around p2p relations, but let's be honest. Your 'girlfriend' is Neck-beard Nelson and your boyfriend might actually be a hardened middleschooler who's seen some rough times at recess on the playground. There is actually very little communication in game unless you're a damsel in distress. Suddenly, those statues you seen in town you thought were afk come gravitating towards you. Put on your most kawaii face, you're about to hit the life of luxury if you play your cards right :3 <3
Let's get real for a brief moment though and talk about the gameplay. You've seen it countless times. Click here, click there, grab this quest, click this monster, click that item. Done. However, with the choppiness of the game, you might find yourself stuck in an infinite loop of running in a line then warping back a few steps or getting stuck on ghost walls. As for npcs and their quests. My initial issue was with the tutorial npcs. The very first npc simply wants you to talk to him and then click the button that completes the quest and rewards you. However, no matter how many times i clicked complete, all i got was the jingle for the completed quest but it never completed.I could click that button as much as i wanted to, but i just got to hear sounds. Relogging didn't work. Reinstallation did, but i ran into the same issue with the following quests after that.

Not even a desperate waifu hunting weeb can justify how bland and uninspired this game is. There was actually a point i felt like i was walking through a reskinned area within SilkRoad Online. It's bad news for this game when the tutorial npcs are bugging out and denying further questline progress. At the very least, such a low end mmo should be easy to manage and not give people grief with loading. High end computer or not, you're in for struggle when in town. Geeze, not even this game want's anything to do with itself.

reviewText:
Lucent Heart has heart, but unfortunately its very buggy and outdated systems keep it from being much more.
I went into this game with an open mind. Something that I try to do for every game I come across and play. Lucent Heart at its core felt like something meant for people who play MMORPGs for their friends and not for incredible polish or tight systems. A few things you'll notice upon logging in both good and bad are:

Graphics are outdated
Playerbase seems very small
Client slow-down (this is one of the more grating aspects of this game)
Very friendly GMs and players
Zone" or "Map" chat is almost always bustling
Zodiac System may be a bit confusing while creating your character. (For help with that: Zodiac System Guide [luheart.wikia.com])
Inventory will start filling almost immediately once you start questing
Lacking in variety for character creation
Lucent Heart was made with community and friendship and relationships in mind
date: that much is clear. This game thrives when you've found your stride with a guild or a group of people to hang out with and help. Much of the early game is severely lonely
recommended:
and asking players in general chat will likely not net you much unless you are in town.

Final Word?

If you're into playing MMORPGs to make new interesting relationships with people online
hoursPlayed: this is your game. If you're into MMORPGs to get satisfaction of actually playing a game
voteText: this isn't for you.\n\nEven so
helpfulPercent: if you've nothing to do and you want to see what this is all about
votesHelpful: it's more than worth giving it a shot. Its couple system is a bit janky
votesTotal: and you nearly never see your match online
votesFunny: but still there's something there for Lucent Heart that a lot of newer MMORPGs are missing. This was definitely crafted and is maintained by people who truly enjoy interaction with others with this game as a medium. That's probably the biggest compliment you could give this type of MMO in my book.\n\nHowever
commentsCount: if you do plan on spending money on this
column16: I would caution that this game's in-steam cash shop costs MORE than just simply going through the subagames website.\n\nEither way
column17: 17 hours in this game has netted me a few friends. Much more than I'd say for some of these newer MMORPGs coming out."
